Class Animal

java.lang.Object
animals.Animal
All Implemented Interfaces:
itumulator.executable.DynamicDisplayInformationProvider, itumulator.simulator.Actor
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bear, Rabbit, Wolf
public abstract class Animal extends Object implements itumulator.simulator.Actor, itumulator.executable.DynamicDisplayInformationProvider

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act(itumulator.world.World world)
      Description copied from interface: itumulator.simulator.Actor
      The method called whenever the actor needs to simulate actions. The worlds 'current location' is only set at the time when the method is called. Thus, if you use setTile, remove, or delete, the current position does not automatically update. This has multiple implications, e.g., if you want to use World.getSurroundingTiles() after using World.setTile(itumulator.world.Location, java.lang.Object) within the act method, the program will throw an exception. This can be circumvented by updating the current location (World.setCurrentLocation(itumulator.world.Location)) or exclusively using the World methods which accepts a location parameter (by the same name).
      Specified by:
      act in interface itumulator.simulator.Actor
      Parameters:
      world - providing details of the position on which the actor is currently located and much more.

    • getInformation

      public itumulator.executable.DisplayInformation getInformation()
      Description copied from interface: itumulator.executable.DynamicDisplayInformationProvider
      Should provide DisplayInformation to determine the visualization of the object.
      Specified by:
      getInformation in interface itumulator.executable.DynamicDisplayInformationProvider
      Returns:

    • randomFreeLocation

      public itumulator.world.Location randomFreeLocation()
      Finds empty surrounding location to move to
      Returns:
      Returns random empty surrounding location if there exists at least 1

      public boolean isBreedable()
      Checks if the animal checks off criteria to breed.
      Returns:
      Returns true if all criteria for breeding are met otherwise returns false.

      public itumulator.world.Location nearestObject(ArrayList<itumulator.world.Location> object)

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • findNearestNest

      public AnimalNest findNearestNest()
      Finds the nearest nest within the animals's vision range.
      Returns:
      the nearest nest object, or null if none are found

    • moveToOrDigHole

      public void moveToOrDigHole()
      Moves the animal toward the nearest nest using moveTowards() if one exists. If no nest is nearby, the animal digs a new nest.
      Parameters:
      world - the world in which the animal is located

    • digHole

      public void digHole()
      Digs a new animal nest at the animals location in the world. This method sets the animals's `animalNest` attribute to the new hole.

    • enterHole

      public void enterHole()
      Makes Animal go inside hole if they are on their hole tile, otherwise throws RunTimeException.

    • exitHole

      public void exitHole()
      Makes animal exit hole if the hole tile is empty.

    • addEnergy

      public void addEnergy(int energy)
      Adds a certain amount of energy.
      Parameters:
      energy - int of amount of energy to add.
